enttyp.enttypd: This dataset is a polygon representation of the parcels for the Town of Hingham, Massachusetts.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: This is a parcel identifier whose purpose is to unambiguously reference one or more polygons on the map.

attrdomv.udom: The content of this field is usually created by concatenating various identifiers, (e.g., map number/map sub-number/parcel number/parcel sub-number, or map/block/lot or section/block/lot) that appear on assessor’s maps.

attr.attrdef: The LOC_ID is a unique identifier for parcels.

attrdomv.udom: Created by combining a letter identifying the units of the coordinates from which the identifier is created ( “F” for units of US Survey Feet and “M” for meters; Massachusetts State Plane System, NAD83 datum) with X and Y coordinate values of a point that lies within the polygon.

attr.attrdef: This attribute indicates whether a tax parcel represents a single parcel in fee ownership or a combined “tax” parcel, and may also be used to code rights-of-way and bodies of water, but ONLY where the boundaries of those features also constitutes a parcel boundary.

attrdomv.udom: Most polygons will be coded “FEE”; those representing dissolved parcels will be coded “TAX”. Polygons may also be coded “WATER” if the parcel boundaries are coincident with the shoreline of a water feature not entirely contained within one parcel and “ROW”(including bicycle paths), “PRIV_ROW”, or “RAIL_ROW” if the right of way polygon does not overlap tax parcel polygons. When a “RAIL_ROW” crosses a “ROW” or “PRIV_ROW” at a grade crossing, the “RAIL_ROW” breaks the “ROW” or “PRIV_ROW”.

attr.attrdef: Map number of the assessor’s map sheet from which the mapping of the parcel in the digital file was created.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are generated by the assessor.

attr.attrdef: The most recent boundary feature source.

attrdomv.udom: Valid values are “ASSESS” (assessor map – this choice includes existing digital files including CAD files and is the default), “SUBDIV” (subdivision plan), “ANR” (subdivision approval not required), “ROAD_LAYOUT”, and “OTHER”).

attr.attrdef: Identifying information for plan (e.g, subdivision or road plan) used to update the digital file.

attrdomv.udom: Unique, identifying information (e.g. recorded book and page) for the referenced plan.

attr.attrdef: The date this parcel polygon was last edited. Initial value will be the date the GIS file was brought to compliance with this standard.

This attribute is used to identify parcels where, although there is a discrepancy between the parcel boundary and features visible on the orthoimage base map, the boundary shown is believed to be correct.

attrdomv.udom:
Null = indicates that no particular attention has been given to checking the compilation of the given parcel
“CC” = this value indicates the compilation has been checked and is entered by the compiler to indicate an apparent discrepancy between the map data and the orthoimage base map where, in their professional judgment and based on the available evidence, the compilation is correct. This might include such anomalies as a parcel boundary cutting off a corner of a building, or a boundary displaced from a feature such as a stone wall that might often indicate the boundary location.
“NR” = This rarely used value indicates that the boundary needs research from primary sources; use of this value by the data developer MUST be accompanied by a separate communication to MassGIS explaining why the circumstances require its use.
“OK” = this value is entered only by MassGIS staff, and indicates that a discrepancy between the boundary compilation and the orthoimagery previously coded as “CC” by the data developer has been approved as being consistent with known information. If a polygon coded in this way is subsequently edited, this attribute would be changed to null or “CC”.

attr.attrdef: This attribute is for identifying parcel polygons whose exclusion from calculations of Level III match rates between parcel polygons and the assessor’s tax list has been approved by MassGIS.

attrdomv.udom: The default value is “N”. The value for parcels approved for exclusion from the match, is “Y”.

attr.attrdef: Town ID from MassGIS towns datalayer.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are generated by MassGIS.

overview.dsoverv: This dataset is a polygon representation of the parcels for the Town of Hingham, Massachusetts. The data was originally compiled in an AutoCAD environment using the measures and angles of parcels as delineated on the original Tax Assessor Maps. Edits were then made to the spatial and tabular data in order to bring the file in compliance with November 2010 MassGIS Level III Standards for Digital Parcel Files. These edits included ensuring that the parcel fabric was continuous and closed with no gaps or overlaps. Additionally, parcels were snapped to the legislatively approved MassGIS TOWNSSURVEY_ARC town boundary datalayer and compared against the 2008 30 cm MassGIS Ortho Imagery. Polygons were assigned a LOC_ID that links to the M131Assessor table and other fields were populated where they were known and applicable.
overview.eaover: For a full description of the features and attributes contained in this data, please refer to the MassGIS Standard for Digital Parcel Files - v2.1: https://www.mass.gov/service-details/massgis-standard-for-digital-parcels-and-related-data-sets.

idinfo.native: This parcel data is submitted to MassGIS in a file geodatabase. It will be incorporated into the MassGIS SDE database, and may be converted into other GIS data types for future distribution.

descript.abstract: This dataset is a polygon representation of the parcels for the Town of Hingham, Massachusetts. The data was originally compiled in an AutoCAD environment and edits were later made through ESRI ArcGIS to the spatial and tabular data in order to bring the file in compliance with November 2010 MassGIS Level III Standards for Digital Parcel Files. These edits included ensuring that the parcel fabric was continuous and closed with no gaps or overlaps. Additionally, parcels were snapped to the legislatively approved MassGIS TOWNSSURVEY_ARC town boundary datalayer and compared against the 2008 30 cm MassGIS Ortho Imagery. Polygons were assigned a LOC_ID that links to the M131Assessor table and other fields were populated where they were known and applicable.
descript.purpose: The purpose of this dataset is to provide the Massachuesetts Office of Geographic Information with a polygon representation of the parcels for the Town of Hingham, Massachuesetts that comply with its Level III standards.

idinfo.accconst: This digital parcel data layer is considered to be in the public domain and will become accessible for download and display from the MassGIS website: http://www.mass.gov/mgis
idinfo.useconst: This data may be appropriate for planning purposes. It should not be utilized where legal and surveyed property boundaries are required.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

distinfo.resdesc: This dataset is a polygon representation of the parcels for the Town of Hingham, Massachusetts. The data was originally compiled in an AutoCAD environment and edits were later made through ESRI ArcGIS to the spatial and tabular data in order to bring the file in compliance with November 2010 MassGIS Level III Standards for Digital Parcel Files. These edits included ensuring that the parcel fabric was continuous and closed with no gaps or overlaps. Additionally, parcels were snapped to the legislatively approved MassGIS TOWNSSURVEY_ARC town boundary datalayer and compared against the 2008 30 cm MassGIS Ortho Imagery. Polygons were assigned a LOC_ID that links to the M131Assessor table and other fields were populated where they were known and applicable.
distinfo.distliab: This parcel data is in the public domain and should not be redistributed for a fee beyond reproduction costs.
distinfo.custom: Upon compliance with level 3 of the MassGIS Standard for Digital Parcel Files, this data will be made available for download on the MassGIS website: http://www.mass.gov/mgis/parcels.htm

cntperp.cntorg: Massachusetts Office of Geographic Information, Commonwealth of Massachusetts

onlinopt.accinstr: Click on the "Download this layer" link to access all digital parcels.

procstep.procdesc: Parcel boundaries were first captured in an AutoCAD environment for each original assessor map using the delineated measures and angles of the parcels. These boundaries were then georectified against visible features of landscape imagery and aligned with groups of parcel on neighboring alignment sheets. Pertinent parcel identiers and attributes were also captured.

Parcels were visually verified against base map features in the 2008/2009 30cm USGS Color Ortho Imagery. Visual inconsistencies between the parcels and imagery of greater than 3m were fixed when such changes were supported by parcel boundaries as shown in the original assessor maps.

Parcel polygons were adjusted to the MassGIS TOWNSURVEY_ARC polyline along boundaries with other towns. Coastal parcel boundaries were generally untouched, except in cases of large discrepancy with MassGIS layer.
Topology rule checks were performed to remove slivers and gaps between taxable parcels.

Tax parcel data checked against CAMA data to identify parcel data missing assessor record information. Discrepancies were addressed through consultation with individual communities and referencing assessor maps and records.

srcinfo.srccontr: The source digital parcel file was originally captured in an AutoCAD environment using the deeded metes and bounds of tax parcels in Hingham, MA. Subsequent edits were made in through ArcGIS.

dataqual.logic: This parcel layer contains discrete, non-overlapping polygons for each property. Adjacent polygons with common ownership and a single tax record have been retained in the "OthLeg" layer that accompanies this TaxPar layer, and dissolved into single parcels in this TaxPar layer. Some non-adjacent parcels may be represented by multi-part polygons where they share common ownership and a single tax record. Public right of ways exist as polygons, not null space. Linework associated with private ROWs are retained in the "OthLeg" layer. Water polygons also representing parcel boundaries have been retained in this TaxPar layer. Additional water features that are not considered parcel boundaries may have been placed in the "Misc" layer that accompanies this TaxPar layer. Easements and other similar non-fee taxable boundaries exist in the 'OthLeg" layer, not the TaxPar layer.

horizpa.horizpar: Data compiled or reviewed for horizontal accuracy ove the MassGIS color orthos from 2008/2009; these orthos are known to be +/- 10' horizontal; however, this data set cannot be used to reach authoritative conclusions about the horizontal accuracy of the boundaries depicted. That work requires a licensed land surveyor.

attracc.attraccr: Required match rate for 7707 parcels: 99.0 pct Total number of parcels with "TAX" or "FEE" POLY_TYPE = 7556 Of these, 7551 join to assessor list. Match rate for "FEE"/"TAX" parcels to assessor table: 99.9 pct Parcel to assessor match rate is ok. Passes QA.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: This dataset is a polygon representation of the parcels for the Town of Hingham, Massachusetts. The data was originally compiled in an AutoCAD environment and edits were later made through ESRI ArcGIS to the spatial and tabular data in order to bring the file in compliance with the MassGIS Level III Standards for Digital Parcel Files. These edits included ensuring that the parcel fabric was continuous and closed with no gaps or overlaps. Additionally, parcels were snapped to the legislatively approved MassGIS TOWNSSURVEY_ARC town boundary datalayer and compared against 2018 7cm ortho imagery, procured through a regional partnership. Polygons were assigned a LOC_ID that links to the M131Assessor table and other fields were populated where they were known and applicable. The dataset is updated annually using similar methodology. Map and owner data up to date as of April 2025.
dataIdInfo.idPurp: The purpose of this dataset is to provide the Massachusetts Bureau of Geographic Information with a polygon representation of the parcels for the Town of Hingham, Massachusetts that comply with its Level III standards.

LegConsts.useLimit: This digital parcel datalayer is considered to be in the public domain and will become accessible for download and display from the MassGIS website: https://www.mass.gov/info-details/massgis-data-layers.
This data may be appropriate for planning purposes. It should not be utilized where legal and surveyed property boundaries are required.

Consts.useLimit: This digital parcel datalayer is considered to be in the public domain and should not be redistributed for a fee beyond reproduction costs.

report.measDesc: Required match rate for 7642 parcels: 99.0% Total number of parcels with "TAX" or "FEE" POLY_TYPE and NO_MATCH = "N": 7620 Minimum number of these 7620 parcels that must link to assessor records to pass QA: 7544 Actual number of these 7620 parcels that link to assessor records: 7609 Observed match rate for "FEE"/"TAX" parcels to assessor table: 99.86%

ConResult.conExpl: Parcel to assessor match rate passes QA.

dataSource.srcDesc: The source digital parcel file was originally captured in an AutoCAD environment using the deeded metes and bounds of tax parcels in Hingham, MA. Subsequent edits were made in through ArcGIS.

dataLineage.statement: This dataset is a polygon representation of the parcels for the Town of Hingham, Massachusetts. The data was originally compiled in an AutoCAD environment and edits were later made through ESRI ArcGIS to the spatial and tabular data in order to bring the file in compliance with MassGIS' Level III Standards for Digital Parcel Files.

prcStep.stepDesc: Parcel boundaries were first captured in an AutoCAD environment for each original assessor map using the delineated measures and angles of the parcels. These boundaries were then georectified against visible features of landscape imagery and aligned with groups of parcel on neighboring alignment sheets. Pertinent parcel identiers and attributes were also captured.

Parcel polygons were adjusted to the MassGIS TOWNSURVEY_ARC polyline along boundaries with other towns. Coastal parcel boundaries were generally untouched, except in cases of large discrepancy with MassGIS layer.

report.measDesc: This parcel layer contains discrete, non-overlapping polygons for each property. Adjacent polygons with common ownership and a single tax record have been retained in the "OthLeg" layer that accompanies this TaxPar layer, and dissolved into single parcels in this TaxPar layer. Some non-adjacent parcels may be represented by multi-part polygons where they share common ownership and a single tax record. Public right of ways exist as polygons, not null space. Linework associated with private ROWs are retained in the "OthLeg" layer. Water polygons also representing parcel boundaries have been retained in this TaxPar layer. Additional water features that are not considered parcel boundaries may have been placed in the "Misc" layer that accompanies this TaxPar layer. Easements and other similar non-fee taxable boundaries exist in the 'OthLeg" layer, not the TaxPar layer.

report.evalMethDesc: Parcels were snapped to the legislatively approved MassGIS TOWNSSURVEY_ARC town boundary datalayer.
